subSections.title: Translingual
Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|[[糹]]([[纟]])}} ''(When used as a left radical component in Chinese)''

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
When used as a {{w|Radical (Chinese characters)|radical component}} on the left, Japanese {{w|Kanji}} and Korean {{w|Hanja}} use a compressed form of 糸 (with {{l|mul|小}} on the bottom, but the centre {{l|mul|亅}} stroke in 小 is written as {{l|mul|丨}} without the bottom hook), which is also the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}. In {{w|traditional Chinese}} and Vietnamese {{w|History of writing in Vietnam|Nom}}, the standard written form of the radical is {{l|mul|糹}} (with three dots on the bottom), while in {{w|simplified Chinese}} the radical is written {{l|mul|纟}} (with a {{l|mul|一}} line below {{l|mul|幺}} that slants upwards).

[[Category:CJKV radicals]]
